p: Rubiolo et al., applied two chromatographic methods (HPLC, GC–MS) for the quantitative determination of phenolic acids and flavonoids, including chrysin, galangin, pinocembrin, pinostrobin and tectochrysin in black poplar bud absolute (produced in Grasse, France). According to HPLC and the GC–MS method, pinostrobin (3.48% and 5.32%), respectively, pinocembrin (2.79% and 3.64%) and chrysin (2.78% and 4.15%) were the most representative compounds in the selected extracts [ 25].
